title: Convert homepage to navigation-based layout with separate section views

requirements.summary: Refactor HomePage.tsx to display a navigation menu with section links instead of rendering all donor sections inline
acceptanceCriteria: Homepage displays clickable section links or buttons for: Total Donor List, Blood Requirement, Appointed Donors, Temporary Rejected Donors, and Permanent Rejected Donors
No donor tables or section details are visible on the initial homepage load
Each section link is clearly labeled and styled consistently with the medical theme

file_operations.description: Replace the current inline section rendering with a navigation menu layout. Remove all section components from the initial render and create a grid or list of clickable section cards/buttons (Total Donor List, Blood Requirement, Appointed Donors, Temporary Rejected Donors, Permanent Rejected Donors). Style the navigation menu using the medical-themed color palette from Tailwind config. Ensure the Add Donor button remains accessible in the navigation view.

requirements.summary: Implement section navigation state management that tracks the active section and displays only its content
acceptanceCriteria: Clicking a section link/button reveals that section's full content (donors table, forms, etc.)
Only one section's details are visible at a time
User can navigate back to the section menu or switch between sections without page reload

file_operations.description: Add React state to track the currently active section (using useState with null or a section identifier). Implement conditional rendering logic that shows the navigation menu when no section is active, and displays the appropriate section component (DonorTable, BloodRequirementForm, AppointedDonorsList, TempRejectedDonorsList, or PermanentRejectedDonorsList) when a section is selected. Wire section buttons to update the active section state on click.

requirements.summary: Add a back button that returns the user from section detail view to the main navigation menu
acceptanceCriteria: A clearly visible back/home button is present when viewing any section detail
Clicking the button returns to the section navigation menu
The navigation state resets so no section details are visible after returning

file_operations.description: Add a back/home button component that appears when a section is active (conditional rendering based on active section state). Position the button prominently at the top of the section detail view. Wire the button's onClick handler to reset the active section state to null, returning the user to the navigation menu. Style the button consistently with the medical theme using existing UI components or Tailwind classes.

requirements.summary: Preserve Add Donor functionality and make it accessible from the section navigation menu or Total Donor List view
acceptanceCriteria: Add Donor button remains functional and accessible
AddDonorDialog continues to work as currently implemented
After adding a donor, user can see the updated list in the Total Donor List section

file_operations.description: Ensure the Add Donor button and AddDonorDialog remain accessible. Position the Add Donor button in the navigation menu view or make it visible when the Total Donor List section is active. Verify that the existing AddDonorDialog component and useAddDonor mutation hook continue to work without modification. After successful donor addition, ensure the user can navigate to or remains in the Total Donor List section to see the updated donor list.
